description: If log_mode is set to 'normal', HANA creates regular log backups, allowing for point-in-time recovery (restoring up to the moment before a failure). If log_mode is set to 'overwrite' , no log backups are created; you can only recover the database to the last data backup.

queries.name: q_log_mode
queries.sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS VALUE FROM M_INIFILE_CONTENTS WHERE FILE_NAME='global.ini' AND SECTION='persistence' AND KEY='log_mode' AND VALUE='overwrite'

actions.description: Log mode is set to 'overwrite'. It is recommended to change the log mode to 'normal' to enable log backups.
